intro: Lithocardium corymbosum var. monogynum, commonly known as the single-flowered lithocardium, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle, aiding in water retention in arid environments. Its flowers are typically borne on short pedicels, and the species is noted for its distinct floral structure and limited geographic distribution. Due to its rarity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
